card.name: Aku Djinn
card.ability:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature each opponent controls.
card.flavor:
"Your arrogance amazes me, Kaervek. Did you not know the price you would pay?"
—Mangara
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : Only puts counters on creatures your opponents control, so in the Two-Headed Giant format, won't put counters on your teammate's creatures.

card.name: Anvil of Bogardan
card.ability:
Players have no maximum hand size.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card, then discards a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the draw part of the effect is skipped due to a replacement effect, the discard part of the effect is not skipped.
10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Anvil of Bogardan onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.
4/15/2013 : The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.
4/15/2013 : If there are two Anvils on the battlefield, they trigger and resolve separately. This means that you first draw one card and discard one card, and then do it again. You do not draw two cards and then discard two cards.

card.name: Archangel
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

card.name: Army Ants
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
"Do not underestimate the power of many against one."
—Sidar Jabari

card.name: Betrayal
card.ability:
Enchant creature an opponent controls
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, you draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Sometimes a burden can be borne only on the shoulders of a willing enemy."
—Suq'Ata aphorism
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it ever enchants a creature that isn't controlled by an opponent of Betrayal's controller, then it's put into the graveyard as a State-Based Action.

card.name: Blanket of Night
card.ability: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
card.flavor:
"Kaervek imprisoned Mangara out of jealousy, but he taints Jamuraa simply out of spite."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land can now be tapped for black mana in addition to any other abilities it already has. This works just as if the text "{Tap}: Add {B} to your mana pool" was added to each mana-producing land. In other words, the land can be tapped for its own ability _or_ it can be tapped for black mana. Not both.
10/4/2004 : Whether the land is a basic land or not is unchanged by this effect.
10/4/2004 : More than one Blanket of Night has no meaningful additional effect.
10/4/2004 : Anything which counts the number of Swamps on the battlefield will not double count an actual Swamp card while Blanket of Night is on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : It can affect lands which do not produce mana.
10/4/2004 : The lands do not get the name "Swamp" in addition to their current name. This is a reversal of older rulings.
10/4/2004 : The ability is a land type change effect so it is ordered along with other land type change effects in the order they entered the battlefield.
10/15/2006 : If this effect is applied to a Snow land, the land is now a Snow Swamp and not just a regular Swamp.

card.name: Bogardan Phoenix
card.ability:
Flying
When Bogardan Phoenix dies, exile it if it had a death counter on it. Otherwise, return it to the battlefield under your control and put a death counter on it.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : Errata streamlined the trigger and got rid of the replacement effect.  In both cases, it will go to the graveyard.  In one it will then come back onto the battlefield; in the other it will then be exiled.

card.name: Brass-Talon Chimera
card.ability:
First strike
Sacrifice Brass-Talon Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains first strike. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Breathstealer's Crypt
card.ability: If a player would draw a card, instead he or she draws a card and reveals it. If it's a creature card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 3 life.
card.flavor:
"Far too many soldiers have died in their beds."
—Telim'Tor

card.name: Breezekeeper
card.ability:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
card.flavor:
"He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind."
—"Song of the Wind Being"

card.name: Brood of Cockroaches
card.ability: When Brood of Cockroaches is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of the next end step, you lose 1 life and return Brood of Cockroaches to your hand.
card.flavor:
"It's like waking on a bed of a thousand olives during an earthquake of subtle force."
—Afari, Tales
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The loss of life is not optional.
10/4/2004 : The life loss and the return to hand both happen at the beginning of the end step as a single effect. It is not two separate effects.

card.name: Bull Elephant
card.ability: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
card.flavor:
Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle

card.name: Chronatog
card.ability: {0}: Chronatog gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can only activate the ability once each turn for each Chronatog.

card.name: City of Solitude
card.ability: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.
card.flavor:
"My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : City of Solitude can affect abilities of cards that are not on the battlefield because it prevents players from activating those abilities.
10/4/2004 : City of Solitude does not stop triggered abilities from being put on the stack. They are never "activated".
10/1/2009 : This stops players from activating mana abilities.

card.name: Cloud Elemental
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor:
"You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

card.name: Coercion
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning "a situation with no choices"

card.name: Coral Atoll
card.ability:
Coral Atoll enters the battlefield tapped.
When Coral Atoll enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {1}{U} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

card.name: Corrosion
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a rust counter on each artifact target opponent controls. Then destroy each artifact with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of rust counters on it. Artifacts destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
When Corrosion leaves the battlefield, remove all rust counters from all permanents.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It does count rust counters put on artifacts by other Corrosion cards. This means that having more than one of these can result in fast destruction of artifacts.
10/4/2004 : In multiplayer games, you can choose a new target player each upkeep.
2/1/2006 : Only puts rust counters on artifacts your opponents control, but destroys all artifacts with rust counters on them, even your own.  When it leaves the battlefield, it removes all rust counters, not just those that happen to be on artifacts.

card.name: Creeping Mold
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
card.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult

card.name: Crypt Rats
card.ability: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana this way.
card.flavor:
"Once I dreamt of death, but now it dreams of me / And only rats and rotting flesh can hear my silent plea."
—Mundungu chant

card.name: Daraja Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
card.flavor:
"And the flamingos said, ‘Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you' So, the griffin ate them."
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

card.name: Dark Privilege
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"As you breathe your last, understand why I accept such forbidden gifts."
—Purraj of Urborg

card.name: Death Watch
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, its controller loses life equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor:
"Watch death wait / Wait, death, watch / Steal breath swiftly / but steal life slowly."
—Suq'Ata dirge

card.name: Desertion
card.ability: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
card.flavor: First the insult, then the injury.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was "cast from your hand" will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
10/4/2004 : This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then this card's ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

card.name: Desolation
card.ability: At the beginning of each end step, each player who tapped a land for mana this turn sacrifices a land. Desolation deals 2 damage to each player who sacrificed a Plains this way.
card.flavor:
"Kill a creature, destroy the present. Kill the land, destroy the future."
—Kaervek
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It works even if it was not on the battlefield when the land was tapped for mana.
10/4/2004 : Each Desolation only causes up to one land per turn to be sacrificed. If you have more than one, each will do this.

card.name: Diamond Kaleidoscope
card.ability:
{3}, {T}: Put a 0/1 colorless Prism artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice a Prism token: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"A pretty toy. Now show me its tactical applications."
—Telim'Tor

card.name: Dormant Volcano
card.ability:
Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Mountain you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {1}{R} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

card.name: Dragon Mask
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor:
"With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."
—Rashida Scalebane

card.name: Dream Tides
card.ability:
Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped nongreen creatures he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : You can only untap nongreen creatures once, since this has a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.

card.name: Dwarven Vigilantes
card.ability: Whenever Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.flavor: Some dwarves can only be pushed so far.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Elephant Grass
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Black creatures can't attack you.
Nonblack creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
card.flavor:
"How have I angered nature that she would imprison me in a labyrinth of grass?"
—Kasib ibn Naji, Letters

card.name: Elkin Lair
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player exiles a card at random from his or her hand. The player may play that card this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, if the player hasn't played the card, he or she puts it into his or her graveyard.
card.ruling:
2/1/2006 : You can play the card this turn, not just during the resolution of the ability.
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Elven Cache
card.ability: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"The elves can hide better than most can look."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

card.name: Emerald Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Untap target permanent; or destroy target non-Aura enchantment; or target creature loses flying until end of turn.

card.name: Equipoise
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number you control, choose a land he or she controls, then the chosen permanents phase out. Repeat this process for artifacts and creatures. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before that player untaps during his or her next untap step.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In multiplayer games, you can choose a different target player each turn. You can even choose yourself.
10/1/2009 : You perform the selection and phasing out on lands first, then on artifacts, then on creatures. This means that if you choose an artifact creature during the second pass, your opponent will control one fewer creature when it comes time to perform the third pass.

card.name: Everglades
card.ability:
Everglades enters the battlefield tapped.
When Everglades enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Swamp you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {1}{B} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

card.name: Eye of Singularity
card.ability:
When Eye of Singularity enters the battlefield, destroy each permanent with the same name as another permanent, except for basic lands. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a permanent other than a basic land enters the battlefield, destroy all other permanents with that name. They can't be regenerated.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a copy card enters the battlefield, the permanent it is copying is destroyed and the copy card stays on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Since phasing in does not cause enters-the-battlefield ability to trigger, it is possible to phase in a card which is already on the battlefield and not trigger this effect.
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Fallen Askari
card.ability:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Fallen Askari can't block.
card.flavor: In troubled times, there are few greater sorrows than a wayward savior.

card.name: Femeref Enchantress
card.ability: Whenever an enchantment is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Then she spread a fine dust over the land, like a butterfly shaking its wing."
—"The Enchantress," Femeref tale
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : If it goes to the graveyard, its ability will not trigger because of any Auras on herself unless those Auras are being destroyed by the same effect that is destroying the Enchantress. This is because those Auras are not put into the graveyard until after she is in the graveyard.

card.name: Feral Instinct
card.ability:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"If a rhino's head is lower than its shoulders, trust me—it is not praying."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

card.name: Fireblast
card.ability:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Fireblast's mana cost.
Fireblast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Embermages aren't well known for their diplomatic skills.

card.name: Firestorm Hellkite
card.ability:
Flying, trample
Cumulative upkeep {U}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
card.flavor:
"If it can scar the sky with fire, do not share its destination."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

card.name: Flooded Shoreline
card.ability: {U}{U}, Return two Islands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Some say the sea is jealous of the land and wishes to climb its heights to meet the sky."
—Afari, Tales

card.name: Forbidden Ritual
card.ability: Sacrifice a nontoken permanent. If you do, target opponent loses 2 life unless he or she sacrifices a permanent or discards a card. You may repeat this process any number of times.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you choose to repeat the process, you repeat the effect but do not get to pick a different target opponent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the target opponent on casting.
10/4/2004 : You sacrifice during resolution, not during casting.

card.name: Foreshadow
card.ability:
Name a card, then target opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you draw a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You name the card on resolution.

card.name: Freewind Falcon
card.ability: Flying, protection from red
card.flavor:
"That does it I'm going back to hunting chickens"
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

card.name: Funeral Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Target player discards a card; or target creature gets +2/-1 until end of turn; or target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Caterpillar
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"‘I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance."
—Afari, Tales
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : It used to make Butterfly tokens. Now it makes Insect tokens named Butterfly.

card.name: Goblin Recruiter
card.ability: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
card.flavor: "Next"
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

card.name: Goblin Swine-Rider
card.ability: Whenever Goblin Swine-Rider becomes blocked, it deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and each blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"May you get the mount you deserve."
—Suq'Ata curse

card.name: Gossamer Chains
card.ability: Return Gossamer Chains to its owner's hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target unblocked creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The return of this card to your hand is part of the activation cost and is paid on activation. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
10/4/2004 : A creature is only considered an "unblocked creature" if it is an attacker during combat after blockers are declared.

card.name: Griffin Canyon
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Untap target Griffin. If it's a creature, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Where are falling feathers deadlier than falling rock?"
—The One Thousand Questions
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This can target an already untapped Griffin, and gives the bonus regardless.

card.name: Guiding Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on top of that player's library.
card.flavor:
"Retainer of eternal Sun Life flash again upon thy wings."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

card.name: Hearth Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target artifact creature; or attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn; or target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

card.name: Heat Wave
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Blue creatures can't block creatures you control.
Nonblue creatures can't block creatures you control unless their controller pays 1 life for each blocking creature he or she controls.

card.name: Helm of Awakening
card.ability: Spells cost {1} less to cast.
card.flavor:
"This little prize will cover your head, your spells, your bets, and your behind"
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
10/4/2004 : This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
10/4/2004 : The effect is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
10/4/2004 : Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
10/4/2004 : If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

card.name: Honorable Passage
card.ability: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.

card.name: Hope Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Target creature gains first strike until end of turn; or target player gains 2 life; or destroy target Aura.

card.name: Hulking Cyclops
card.ability: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
card.flavor:
"Some say a great cyclops turns the world in its hands, looking down upon it with its one bright eye."
—Afari, Tales

card.name: Impulse
card.ability: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.flavor:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This is not a draw.
10/4/2004 : Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

card.name: Infantry Veteran
card.ability: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor
card.ruling: 8/15/2010 : An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

card.name: Infernal Harvest
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Infernal Harvest, return X Swamps you control to their owner's hand.
Infernal Harvest deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
card.flavor:
"I offered you eternal life; I just didn't say where."
—Shauku, Endbringer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The return of X of your Swamps to your hand is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
10/4/2004 : You can use X as being zero.
10/4/2004 : If X is greater than zero, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets. If X is zero, you can't choose any targets.

card.name: Inspiration
card.ability: Target player draws two cards.
card.flavor:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

card.name: Iron-Heart Chimera
card.ability:
Vigilance
Sacrifice Iron-Heart Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains vigilance. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Jamuraan Lion
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
card.flavor:
The lion blinked
—Femeref expression meaning "situation avoided"

card.name: Juju Bubble
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When you play a card, sacrifice Juju Bubble.
{2}: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"If my heart had a lid, I would lift it and show you my joy."
—From Suq'Ata wedding ceremony
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It does not matter if the card is played from your hand or from somewhere else.

card.name: Jungle Basin
card.ability:
Jungle Basin enters the battlefield tapped.
When Jungle Basin enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Forest you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {1}{G} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

card.name: Kaervek's Spite
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Kaervek's Spite, sacrifice all permanents you control and discard your hand.
Target player loses 5 life.
card.flavor:
"The end justifies the means. What do I care if I rule over the dead rather than over the living? The dead ask fewer questions."
—Kaervek
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of all your permanents and discarding of your hand is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
10/4/2004 : As always, you can't sacrifice things you do not control.

card.name: Karoo
card.ability:
Karoo enters the battlefield tapped.
When Karoo enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Plains you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {1}{W} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

card.name: Katabatic Winds
card.ability:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Creatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
card.flavor: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

card.name: Keeper of Kookus
card.ability: {R}: Keeper of Kookus gains protection from red until end of turn.
card.flavor: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.

card.name: King Cheetah
card.ability: Flash
card.flavor:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : King Cheetah is always a Creature spell, never an Instant, regardless of when you cast it.

card.name: Knight of the Mists
card.ability:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
When Knight of the Mists enters the battlefield, you may pay {U}. If you don't, destroy target Knight and it can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Fear the mists, for they are armed.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If no other Knights are on the battlefield, pay the mana or destroy this card.
10/4/2004 : Can destroy an opponent's knight.

card.name: Knight of Valor
card.ability:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: Each creature without flanking blocking Knight of Valor gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The second ability is not Flanking and is not removed by an effect that removes Flanking.

card.name: Kookus
card.ability:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you don't control a creature named Keeper of Kookus, Kookus deals 3 damage to you and attacks this turn if able.
{R}: Kookus gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Kyscu Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{G}: Kyscu Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
Sacrifice Kyscu Drake and a creature named Spitting Drake: Search your library for a card named Viashivan Dragon and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Lead-Belly Chimera
card.ability:
Trample
Sacrifice Lead-Belly Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Lichenthrope
card.ability:
If damage would be dealt to Lichenthrope, put that many -1/-1 counters on it instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from Lichenthrope.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card's effect replaces damage with placement of -1/-1 counters, so side-effects of damage to it will not trigger.

card.name: Lightning Cloud
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {R}. If you do, Lightning Cloud deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
The mightiest clouds sit upon spires of fire.
—Femeref adage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Triggers when the spell is cast.
10/4/2004 : You pick the target when putting the triggered ability on the stack, but you don't choose whether or not to pay {R} until the triggered ability resolves.

card.name: Longbow Archer
card.ability: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"If it bears wings, I will put it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Ruya, Zhalfirin archer
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Magma Mine
card.ability:
{4}: Put a pressure counter on Magma Mine.
{T}, Sacrifice Magma Mine: Magma Mine deals damage equal to the number of pressure counters on it to target creature or player.
card.flavor: BOOM

card.name: Man-o'-War
card.ability: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can choose itself. It has to if there are no other creatures.

card.name: Matopi Golem
card.ability: {1}: Regenerate Matopi Golem. When it regenerates this way, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
card.flavor: Some potmakers claim to use the mud of such creatures to make their finest bowls—and that the bowls scream when fired.

card.name: Miraculous Recovery
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor:
"You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

card.name: Mob Mentality
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.
Whenever all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
card.flavor:
"Why is loud stupidity so infectious?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

card.name: Mortal Wound
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
card.flavor:
"Their tears spill over Jamuraa. Mixed with blood, they wash everything red."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

card.name: Mundungu
card.ability: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} and 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Our buried kings silently await the revolt of dead peasants."
—Tuwile, mundungu of Aku

card.name: Mystic Veil
card.ability:
You may cast Mystic Veil as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."
—Poetics of Hanan
card.ruling:
8/1/2005 : Does not destroy Auras which are already on the creature.
10/1/2009 : The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

card.name: Natural Order
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: . . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of a green creature is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
10/4/2004 : You do not have to find a green creature card if you do not want to.

card.name: Necromancy
card.ability:
You may cast Necromancy as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
When Necromancy enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Necromancy." Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control and attach Necromancy to it. When Necromancy leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The bringing of the creature onto the battlefield and then putting Necromancy on it is all done as part of the resolution.
10/4/2004 : When putting a card onto the battlefield that requires a definition for its value or some other choice, you do what is needed to define the value or make the choice.
8/1/2005 : Necromancy enters the battlefield as an enchantment and then becomes an Enchant Creature Aura as a triggered ability upon entering the battlefield. It follows all the rules for Auras from then on.
4/1/2008 : If the creature card put onto the battlefield has Protection from Black (or anything that prevents this from legally being attached), this won’t be able to attach to it. Then this will go to the graveyard as a State-Based Action, causing the creature to be sacrificed.
10/1/2009 : The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

card.name: Necrosavant
card.ability: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.flavor:
"Ah, I remember my first death."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

card.name: Nekrataal
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Nothing happens if there are no non-artifact, non-black creatures on the battlefield when it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Ogre Enforcer
card.ability: Ogre Enforcer can't be destroyed by lethal damage unless lethal damage dealt by a single source is marked on it.
card.flavor:
"Ate up all of his siblings in the first week. A good beginning for one destined to command."
—Suka, ogre matron
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If its toughness falls to zero or less and it is undamaged, it will still be put into the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : The check for nonlethal damage is done on a per-source basis. So each source's damage is checked independently and it is not possible to team up sources (such as creatures) in order to kill it.

card.name: Ovinomancer
card.ability:
When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.
{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller puts a 0/1 green Sheep creature token onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can target itself. This will cause it to be returned to your hand during announcement and will result in no sheep since it will not be on the battlefield at resolution so the effect fails since it target is illegal.

card.name: Panther Warriors
card.flavor:
"When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

card.name: Parapet
card.ability:
You may cast Parapet as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
card.flavor: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

card.name: Peace Talks
card.ability: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
card.flavor:
"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."
—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can be cast after your attack.
10/4/2004 : It affects the current turn and the next turn. This could affect the same player twice if they have two turns in a row, or it could affect different players. In a multiplayer game it affects exactly two turns, not a full round of turns.
2/1/2006 : Doesn't skip the Combat Phase, just renders creatures unable to attack.

card.name: Phyrexian Marauder
card.ability:
Phyrexian Marauder enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Phyrexian Marauder can't block.
Phyrexian Marauder can't attack unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Phyrexian Walker
card.flavor:
"I have heard terrible tales of black rains, ashen fields, and metal that screams. I have consoled myself that the tales were a myth of some fevered mind. But today I saw a walker—and now I fear the truth."
—Kasib Ibn Naji, Letters

card.name: Pillar Tombs of Aku
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may sacrifice a creature. If that player doesn't, he or she loses 5 life and you sacrifice Pillar Tombs of Aku.
card.flavor:
"Aku, City of Hidden Graves / Aku, City of Lost Kings / Aku, welcome me."
—Pillar tomb inscription
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Prosperity
card.ability: Each player draws X cards.
card.flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

card.name: Pygmy Hippo
card.ability: Whenever Pygmy Hippo attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player activate a mana ability of each land he or she controls and empty his or her mana pool. If you do, Pygmy Hippo assigns no combat damage this turn and at the beginning of your postcombat main phase, you add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the amount of mana emptied from defending player's mana pool this way.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that doesn't target and could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Python
card.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

card.name: Quicksand
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

card.name: Quirion Druid
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"The land has been gracious enough to let you tread upon her for years. That privilege is about to end."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Quirion Ranger
card.ability: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor:
"Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can target an untapped creature.

card.name: Raging Gorilla
card.ability: Whenever Raging Gorilla blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Every temper tantrum makes another angry gorilla."
—Femeref children's myth

card.name: Rainbow Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
{U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
card.flavor:
"A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations."
—Teferi

card.name: Relentless Assault
card.ability: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
card.flavor:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
10/4/2004 : Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
10/4/2004 : A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
10/4/2004 : It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

card.name: Relic Ward
card.ability:
You may cast Relic Ward as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Asmira's prayers alone should have freed Mangara from the amber prison . . .
card.ruling:
8/1/2005 : Does not destroy Auras which are on the artifact, and it does not prevent Auras from being moved onto the artifact.
10/1/2009 : The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

card.name: Remedy
card.ability: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.
card.flavor:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose the targets and you choose how to divide up the 5 damage on announcement.
10/4/2004 : You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

card.name: Resistance Fighter
card.ability: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
card.flavor:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari

card.name: Retribution of the Meek
card.ability: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

card.name: Righteous Aura
card.ability: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor:
"Good is not a ‘thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

card.name: Righteous War
card.ability:
White creatures you control have protection from black.
Black creatures you control have protection from white.
card.flavor:
"This is a war without neutrality."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

card.name: River Boa
card.ability:
Islandwalk
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
card.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

card.name: Rock Slide
card.ability: Rock Slide deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.
card.flavor:
"Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : X can be zero.
10/4/2004 : If X is greater than zero, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets. If X is zero, you can't choose any targets.

card.name: Rowen
card.ability: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

card.name: Sands of Time
card.ability:
Each player skips his or her untap step.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player simultaneously untaps each tapped artifact, creature, and land he or she controls and taps each untapped artifact, creature, and land he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"But once, with a magician's help, Time was stopped and Day stood still."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card still affects players when it is tapped.
8/1/2008 : Skipping the untap step means that phased out cards won't phase in, and permanents with phasing won't phase out.
10/1/2009 : You can tap lands for mana before Sands of Time toggles your permanents. The mana you gain is in your mana pool during your upkeep step, but will disappear before your draw step if you don't spend it. You cannot save it to be spent on the card you will draw this turn.

card.name: Scalebane's Elite
card.ability: Protection from black
card.flavor:
"With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

card.name: Shimmering Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Whenever Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out. (It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
card.flavor:
Life or death: which is the illusion?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If it phases in and no other creatures are on the battlefield, it will phase itself back out.
10/4/2004 : If two of these phase in, they can both target the same creature and have just that one creature phase out.

card.name: Shrieking Drake
card.ability:
Flying
When Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise."
—Teferi
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

card.name: Simoon
card.ability: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
card.flavor:
"The black-and-white sacred monkey holds her children to her, and waits."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

card.name: Sisay's Ring
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"With this ring, you have friends in worlds you've never heard of."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

card.name: Snake Basket
card.ability: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Put X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor:
"Uh, does anyone have a flute?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : It used to make Cobra tokens. Now it makes Snake tokens.

card.name: Solfatara
card.ability:
Target player can't play land cards this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"A burst of hot air tossed the moon into the air, and the moon liked it up there so much it never needed the ground again."
—Azeworai, "Glitter Moon"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Prevents all land playing that turn, not just one land.
10/4/2004 : Does not prevent effects from putting a land onto the battlefield.

card.name: Song of Blood
card.ability:
Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
Whenever a creature attacks this turn, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each creature card put into your graveyard this way.
card.flavor: Purraj sang slaughter and danced death.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If a creature attacks more than once in a turn, it gets the bonus each time.

card.name: Spider Climb
card.ability:
You may cast Spider Climb as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

card.name: Spitting Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.

card.name: Squandered Resources
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce.
card.flavor:
"He traded sand for skins, skins for gold, gold for life. In the end, he traded life for sand."
—Afari, Tales
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can sacrifice a land which can't produce mana, but you don't get any mana from this ability.

card.name: Stampeding Wildebeests
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Prayers for rain are answered with the thunder of hooves.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability that returns a creature doesn't target anything. You can return a creature with shroud or protection from green, for example. You don't decide which creature to return until the ability resolves. If you control no other green creatures, you must return Stampeding Wildebeests itself.
10/4/2004 : You choose a creature and return it all during resolution of the triggered ability. This means that if you have two Wildebeests, there is no way to end up returning only one creature.

card.name: Suleiman's Legacy
card.ability:
When Suleiman's Legacy enters the battlefield, destroy all Djinns and Efreets. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a Djinn or Efreet enters the battlefield, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: With Suleiman's ascension to power, the djinn and efreets of ancient Rabiah learned humility.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does nothing to Djinns or Efreets that phase in while it is on the battlefield.

card.name: Summer Bloom
card.ability: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
card.flavor:
"Our love is like the river in the summer season of long rains. / For a little while it spilled its banks, flooding the crops in the fields."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

card.name: Sun Clasp
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"And darkness shall be cast from me
For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge

card.name: Suq'Ata Assassin
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Suq'Ata Assassin attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Suq'Ata Lancer
card.ability:
Haste
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
card.flavor:
"Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."
—Telim'Tor

card.name: Talruum Champion
card.ability:
First strike
Whenever Talruum Champion blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: In the Talruum language, there is no word for "surprised."

card.name: Talruum Piper
card.ability: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.
card.flavor: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.

card.name: Tar Pit Warrior
card.ability: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
card.flavor:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : You can move an Aura onto this card using an untargeted spell or ability without causing this card to be sacrificed.

card.name: Teferi's Honor Guard
card.ability:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{U}{U}: Teferi's Honor Guard phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
card.flavor:
"They may seem ceremonial, but their swords are still sharp."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

card.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

card.name: Teferi's Realm
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses artifact, creature, land, or non-Aura enchantment. All nontoken permanents of that type phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
card.flavor:
"Fire is dead. Water has killed him."
—From The Stories of Nature
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not affect token permanents, only cards.
8/1/2005 : Can affect itself if you choose "non-Aura enchantment".
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Tempest Drake
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor:
"Its speed will be equaled only by the swiftness of my enemy's fall."
—Kaervek

card.name: Three Wishes
card.ability: Exile the top three cards of your library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled. Until your next turn, you may play those cards. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put any of those cards you didn't play into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can look at the three exiled cards at any time.
10/4/2004 : You can only play them before the start of your upkeep. Between the start of your upkeep and putting the extra cards into the graveyard, you can't play them.
10/4/2004 : To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.

card.name: Time and Tide
card.ability: Simultaneously, all phased-out creatures phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.
card.flavor:
"Time may heal all wounds, but what heals time?"
—Teferi

card.name: Tin-Wing Chimera
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Tin-Wing Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Tithe
card.ability: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Counts lands on resolution, not on announcement.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Tremor
card.ability: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

card.name: Triangle of War
card.ability: {2}, Sacrifice Triangle of War: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Those creatures fight each other. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
card.flavor: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If either target is illegal when the ability resolves, it will do nothing.

card.name: Uktabi Orangutan
card.ability: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

card.name: Undiscovered Paradise
card.ability: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It will return even if some effect prevents you from untapping it. The ability is not replacing the untapping of the land in any way.
10/4/2004 : Only returns to owner's hand if it is still on the battlefield at the beginning of its controller's next untap.

card.name: Undo
card.ability: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
"Oft have I wished to undo past deeds, but never did I imagine they would be undone for me."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

card.name: Urborg Mindsucker
card.ability: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor:
"My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."
—Kaervek
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Vampiric Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
card.flavor:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

card.name: Vampirism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Vampirism enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
Other creatures you control get -1/-1.

card.name: Vanishing
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{U}{U}: Enchanted creature phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
card.flavor:
"Careless, like a child with fire, so was I with time."
—Teferi

card.name: Viashino Sandstalker
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor:
"Some believe Sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

card.name: Viashivan Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Viashivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Viashivan Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.

card.name: Vision Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard; or choose a land type and a basic land type, and each land of the first chosen type becomes the second chosen type until end of turn; or target artifact phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : All lands changed are changed to the same type.

card.name: Wake of Vultures
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
card.flavor:
"So the vulture said to the griffin, ‘You gonna eat that?'"
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

card.name: Wand of Denial
card.ability: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor: You'll never miss what you never had.

card.name: Warrior's Honor
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."
—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : Warrior's Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won't get the bonus.

card.name: Warthog
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

card.name: Waterspout Djinn
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Waterspout Djinn unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Fly us higher, out of its storm."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose a land to return and return it during resolution of the upkeep triggered ability. This means if you have two Waterspout Djinns, they must each return different Islands.

card.name: Wicked Reward
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Wicked Reward, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."
—Kaervek
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Wind Shear
card.ability: Attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"As the winds abated, there was a shower of dragonscales, then nothing more."
—Azeworai, "The Unruly Wind"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The -2/-2 and loss of Flying both last until end of turn. The -2/-2 is not permanent.

card.name: Zhalfirin Crusader
card.ability:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zhalfirin Crusader this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
card.flavor:
"War is the crucible of leadership."
—Rashida Scalebane
